ui.navDisabled: Scene Navigation is disabled in the 'Elements' tab. The settings below will only have effect if Custom Layout is enabled for Scene Navigation.
ui.reloadRequiredLabel: A reload is required. Reload now?

notifications.incompatibleVersion: Carolingian UI requires Foundry v13.339 or higher. Please update Foundry or install version 1.x of Carolingian UI.
notifications.minimalUiNotSupported: Carolingian UI is not compatible with Minimal UI, and offers most of its features. Please disable that module to avoid performance issues.
notifications.monksScenesNotSupported: Carolingian UI's Scene Navigation and Monk's Scene Navigation are NOT compatible. Please either disable Monk's Scene Navigation or uncheck 'Custom Layout' for Scene Navigation in settings.
notifications.ripperScenesCompat: Carolingian UI now has Scene Folder Navigation and Scene Search, which cannot be used together with Compact Scene Navigation. Either disable the other module or disable 'Scene Folder Navigation' on Carolingian UI settings.
notifications.monksPlayerSettingsConflict: Carolingian UI's setting 'Enforce Dark Mode' has been disabled to prevent conflict with the module Monk's Player Settings.
notifications.forceClientSettingsConflict: Carolingian UI's setting 'Enforce Dark Mode' has been disabled to prevent conflict with Force Client Settings.
notifications.initialViewSet: This scene's initial view was set to the current view.

updates.label: Last Update ID
updates.hint: Tracks the last displayed update notification

supportPatreon.label: Support the developer
supportPatreon.hint: If you like Carolingian UI and my other modules, consider supporting the development with a few bucks per month.

moduleSettingsMenu.label: Interface Settings
moduleSettingsMenu.title: Configure Options
moduleSettingsMenu.hint: Customize Carolingian UI, enable or disable custom styles and other options.

hideInterface.label: Toggle Hide/Show Interface
hideInterface.hint: Hides or shows the UI. This will affect all elements inside the `#interface` html block

interfaceOptionsMenu.label: Fade-out & Layout
interfaceOptionsMenu.title: Interface Fade-out & Layout
interfaceOptionsMenu.hint: Disable 'fade out' behavior of interface elements individually. You may also disable Carolingian UI custom layout for them.
interfaceOptionsMenu.description: 'Fade Out' column: Uncheck to prevent element from fading out when not hovered. 'Custom Layout' column: Uncheck to disable Carolingian UI styles for that particular element. Color theming and fonts will still apply.

customFontsMenu.label: Fonts
customFontsMenu.title: Configure Fonts
customFontsMenu.hint: Configure the font families used throughout the interface
customFontsMenu.description: Select or type the name of a custom font, if already loaded on Foundry core.
customFontsMenu.postDescription: To import from Google Fonts, first paste the @import link in the "Custom CSS" field of style settings, and the font will be listed here.

themeAndStylesMenu.label: Theme
themeAndStylesMenu.title: Configure Styles
themeAndStylesMenu.hint: Select a color theme for the UI, and add custom CSS styles.

colorTheme.label: Color Theme (World)
colorTheme.hint: Select an option for the color highlights and secondary color. Only affects highlights, inputs and buttons. Player color theme can override this setting.

playerColorTheme.label: Color Theme (Player)
playerColorTheme.hint: Select an option for the color highlights and secondary color. Only affects highlights, inputs and buttons

customThemeColors.label: Custom Theme Colors (World)
customThemeColors.hint: Custom color configuration for the world theme

playerCustomThemeColors.label: Custom Theme Colors (Player)
playerCustomThemeColors.hint: Custom color configuration for this player

fields.customizeHint: Click to open the color picker and create custom theme colors

adjustOtherModules.label: Enforce styles in other modules
adjustOtherModules.hint: Enable my style tweaks and custom fonts on other modules, like CRUX or Combat Carousel. If you would like support for a specific module, please request on Github issues

applyDarkThemeToModules.label: Apply Dark Theme to Modules' Windows
applyDarkThemeToModules.hint: Some modules never implemented dark theme. This option attempts to apply dark theme to other modules' windows using .app.theme-light class. If some module becomes partiallyillegible, uncheck this option.

otherModulesList.label: Enforce styles in other modules
otherModulesList.hint: Enable my style tweaks on other modules. Click the checkbox on top of the list to select / unselect all.

forcedDarkTheme.label: Force Dark Theme via CSS
forcedDarkTheme.hint: EXPERIMENTAL. If the above checkbox doesn't work for a specific module, you may attempt to force dark background and light font to modules by css selector. It might not always work if modules have hardcoded styles. Enter in the field belowthe css id or class of the elements, separated by comma. Example: #element-id, .element-class

customStyles.label: Custom CSS
customStyles.hint: These styles will be loaded the next time you load Foundry. You may include Google Fonts by pasting the @import link, and the font will be listed in the Custom Fonts settings.

enforceDarkMode.label: Enforce Dark Mode to Players
enforceDarkMode.hint: Do not enable this if using Force Client Settings or similar modules. This sets Foundry's UI theme on player's client to Dark if they have it set to 'Browser Default'. If they specifically set it to 'Light', their choice will be respected.

chatMessagesMenu.label: Chat
chatMessagesMenu.title: Configure Chat
chatMessagesMenu.hint: Modify the look and behavior of the chat message cards on right side panel

enableChatStyles.label: Enable styles for chat messages
enableChatStyles.hint: Adds style modifications to chat cards. When dark mode is selected on Foundry, chat cards will be dark as well. MOSTLY FOR DND5E - only partial support for other systems.

borderColor.label: Color of chat card border
borderColor.hint: [Requires reload] Player color: uses the player's color on Foundry; Roll Type: uses color coding for attack, save, skill check, etc. None: no border at all (will allow borders set by other modules).

borderPosition.label: Position of colored border
borderPosition.hint:
[Requires reload] Left: border shows up only on the left side of the chat card.
Top: border shows up only on the top side of the chat card.
None: no border at all (will allow borders set by other modules).
All: border shows up on all sides of the chat card.

useLeftChatBorder.label: Use left border only
useLeftChatBorder.hint: Your border color choice shows up on the left side of the chat card only - the other sides have no border.

sideBarWidth.label: Sidebar width
sideBarWidth.hint: Width of the sidebar panel on the right side of the screen.

leftControlsMenu.label: Control Bar
leftControlsMenu.title: Configure Controls
leftControlsMenu.hint: Modify the look and behavior of scene control buttons, on the left side of screen

autoHideSecondary.label: Auto hide secondary controls
autoHideSecondary.hint: Enable to keep the secondary bar on the left controls hidden until you hover on the region or click on an item.

playersListMenu.label: Players List
playersListMenu.title: Player List Options
playersListMenu.hint: Change behavior or add avatars to players list

autoHidePlayerList.label: Auto hide player list
autoHidePlayerList.hint: Enable to keep the players list on bottom left minimized, except when hovered.

playerListAvatars.label: Show avatars
playerListAvatars.hint: Show player avatars for players in the list. It looks for character image, or user image if no character is assigned

cameraDockMenu.label: Camera Dock
cameraDockMenu.title: Configure Dock
cameraDockMenu.hint: Enable a floating camera dock that you can position anywhere

enableFloatingDock.label: Enable floating camera dock
enableFloatingDock.hint: [Requires reload] Allows video player group to be dragged and placed anywhere on screen

dockPosX.label: Dock Horizontal position
dockPosX.hint: Position of camera dock when set to float. From bottom left of screen, in pixels

dockPosY.label: Dock Vertical position
dockPosY.hint: Position of camera dock when set to float. From bottom left of screen, in pixels

dockWidth.label: Width of camera group
dockWidth.hint: Dimensions of the non-minimized camera dock when set to float, in pixels

dockHeight.label: Height of camera group
dockHeight.hint: Dimensions of the non-minimized camera dock when set to float, in pixels

dockResizeOnUserJoin.label: Resize Dock to Fit Videos
dockResizeOnUserJoin.hint: When enabled, the dock will be resized when a user joins. Any manual resize may be overriden when a new user joins. For manual resize, turn this option off.

defaultVideoWidth.label: Default video width
defaultVideoWidth.hint: Width of each individual camera in dock, in pixels. Minimum width is 140px, to allow space for camera control icons.

sceneNavMenu.label: Scene Nav
sceneNavMenu.title: Configure Scene Nav
sceneNavMenu.hint: Change options for the scene navigation menu, on the top bar.

sceneNavEnabled.label: Enable custom scene navigation
sceneNavEnabled.hint: [Requires reload] If you are having layout issues with a non-compatible module, you can try to disable my custom styles for Scene Navigation.

showNavOnHover.label: Toggle scene navigation on hover
showNavOnHover.hint: If the scene navigation is collapsed, you can show it by hovering the mouse over the top of the screen.

useSceneFolders.label: Enable scene folders on navigation
useSceneFolders.hint: If custom scene navigation is enabled, this option will add a list of folders with scene search to scene navigation bar.

useSceneLookup.label: Enable scene lookup on navigation
useSceneLookup.hint: If custom scene navigation is enabled, this option will add a button to search for scenes on the navigation bar.

navFoldersForPlayers.label: Enable scene folders for players
navFoldersForPlayers.hint: Enable to allow players to see the folder list. If they do not have view permissions for a folder, it will not appear on the list.

navStartCollapsed.label: Start collapsed
navStartCollapsed.hint: Enable this option to collapse the scene navigation when loading Foundry, regardless of previous saved state.

sceneClickToView.label: Enable Click/Double Click to View/Activate
sceneClickToView.hint: When enabled, clicking on the scene in scene once opens that scene. Double clicking activates it.

useSceneIcons.label: Use scene icons
useSceneIcons.hint: Shows icons next to the scene name. Invisible to players until activated; Currently viewed by the GM; Currently active to players;

useSceneBackButton.label: Enable Back Button
useSceneBackButton.hint: Add a back button to scene navigation, which lets you quick change back to previous scene viewed

useScenePreview.label: Use Scene Preview
useScenePreview.hint: When enabled, the thumbnail preview will be shown when hovering over scene navigation

navShowRootFolders.label: Show root folders in scene navigation
navShowRootFolders.hint: Root folders from Scene Directory will be show in the default scene navigation. If you have many folders on root, you might want to disable this option.

hideInactiveOnFolderToggle.label: Hide inactive scenes on folder toggle
hideInactiveOnFolderToggle.hint: When enabled, default list of scenes will be hidden when folder view is on. The list will show up again when you hide folders. This aims to avoid duplication of scenes in navigation.

sceneItemWidth.label: Width of navigation item
sceneItemWidth.hint: Leave empty to use default width, or define a new number. Minimum is 100px

sheets5eMenu.label: DnD5e Sheets
sheets5eMenu.title: Configure styling options for DnD5e Sheets

applyThemeToSheets.label: Apply styles to actor sheets (DnD5e, Daggerheart)
applyThemeToSheets.hint: Enable to apply global color theme and styles to actor sheets (PC and NPC). This currently works for DnD5e and Foundryborne Daggerheart

useHorizontalSheetTabs.label: Use horizontal tabs with labels on 5e sheets
useHorizontalSheetTabs.hint: Enable to use horizontal tabs with labels on 5e actor sheets instead of the lateral icon tabs

enforceGMSettings.label: Enforce GM Settings to Players
enforceGMSettings.hint: When enabled, all players will use the GM's UI settings when they connect. This ensures a consistent UI experience across all players.

defaultSettings.label: Default GM Settings
defaultSettings.hint: Stores the GM's preferred settings for enforcement to players

controlIconSize.label: Size of control icons
controlIconSize.hint: If you use a large resolution, you may want to change the size of the icons on left controls. This may affect some other UI elements

sceneNavCollapsed.label: Scene navigation collapsed
sceneNavCollapsed.hint: Current state of the scene navigation toggle. Is it collapsed?

sceneNavPos.label: Scene navigation position
sceneNavPos.hint: Stores current position of navigation for reset when it's re-rendered

enableMacroLayout.label: Enable macro layout
enableMacroLayout.hint: The module enlarges and centralizes numbers on macro hotbar. Disable this setting to use default Foundry layout.

autoHideLeftControls.label: Auto hide secondary controls
autoHideLeftControls.hint: Enable to keep the secondary bar on the left controls hidden unless you hover on the region or click on an item.

collapseMacroBar.label: Auto-Hide Macro Bar
collapseMacroBar.hint: Enable to have the macro hotbar start collapsed by default, and show up on hover.

useFolderStyle.label: Discreet folder colors on sidebar
useFolderStyle.hint: Enable more discreet colors on sidebar directory folders, showing the selected color only on the borders, for a nicer look.

debugMode.label: Debug Mode
debugMode.hint: Enable or disable debug messages on browser console. This should be turned off unless the module developer asks you to turn it on for verification.

disableUI.label: Disable UI in this client
disableUI.hint: If a player doesn't want to use Carolingian UI, they may disable it. No other feature of the module will work except for dark style in chat cards - which can be separately disabled.

colorPicker.hint: With great colors comes great responsibility. Remember to care for your retinas: for the accent color, use colors with at least a 'medium' contrast rating for better readability.
colorPicker.title: Custom Theme Colors

applySecondaryColorToBg.label: Apply Secondary color to Foundry interface backgrounds
applySecondaryColorToBg.hint: When enabled, the secondary color will be applied to interface backgrounds like sidebar and controls. This creates a more unified color theme.
